episodeTitle: Something Has Happened to Hordy! The True Power of the Evil Drug!
episodeTitleJapanese: ホーディの異変 凶薬の真の力！
episodeTitleRomanized: Hōdi no Ihen - Kyōyaku no Shin no Chikara!
description: Hody Jones overdoses on Energy Steroids, transforming into a more powerful and monstrous form with white hair and massive muscles. Meanwhile, the New Fish-Man Pirates officers rampage across Fish-Man Island as they advance toward Gyoncorde Plaza, and the three Neptune princes depart to save their father.

events.title: New Fish-Man Pirates Officers Begin Their Rampage
events.description: The New Fish-Man Pirates officers - Daruma, Dosun, Hyouzou, Zeo, and Ikaros Much - begin advancing toward Gyoncorde Plaza while devastating different districts of Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: Sets up the scope of the threat facing Fish-Man Island and shows the officers' individual destructive capabilities.

events.title: Daruma Chews Through the Candy Factory
events.description: Daruma, the cookiecutter shark fish-man, uses his powerful burrowing abilities and jaw strength to chew through the Candy Factory on Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: Demonstrates Daruma's destructive eating abilities and his carnal urge to bite through structures.

events.title: Hyouzou's Drunken Sword Rampage
events.description: Hyouzou, the strongest swordsman on Fish-Man Island, drunkenly wields his swords to terrorize the fishmen, displaying his alarming speed and deadly skill.
events.significance: Establishes Hyouzou as a dangerous threat even while intoxicated, foreshadowing his eventual confrontation with Zoro.

events.title: Zeo Uses Camouflaging Technique
events.description: Zeo, the Japanese wobbegong fish-man, demonstrates his ability to camouflage himself, becoming completely invisible as he advances toward the plaza.
events.significance: Shows Zeo's unique ability that makes him one of Hody's strongest lieutenants and a difficult opponent to combat.

events.title: Dosun Breaks Free After Taking Energy Steroids
events.description: Dosun, the hammerhead shark fish-man, consumes Energy Steroids and breaks free from his chains. He begins rampaging and destroying buildings with his massive hammer.
events.significance: First demonstration of how Energy Steroids enhance the already formidable strength of the New Fish-Man Pirates officers.

events.title: Vander Decken Decides to Kill Shirahoshi
events.description: On the Noah, Vander Decken IX shaves off his head and makes the decision to kill Princess Shirahoshi, escalating his obsessive pursuit.
events.significance: Marks a turning point in Vander Decken's pursuit of Shirahoshi, from obsessive love to murderous intent.

events.title: The Neptune Princes Depart to Save Their Father
events.description: Fukaboshi, Manboshi, and Ryuboshi, the three strongest warriors in the Neptune Army, begin their journey toward Gyoncorde Plaza to rescue their captured father, King Neptune.
events.significance: Demonstrates the princes' loyalty and courage as they rush to save their father despite the overwhelming threat.

events.title: Fukaboshi Reconsiders His Opinion of the Straw Hats
events.description: While traveling to the plaza, Fukaboshi comments that he thinks the Straw Hats are not bad people and may have been misjudged. His brothers Manboshi and Ryuboshi agree with this assessment.
events.significance: Shows the growing respect the Neptune family has for the Straw Hat Pirates, recognizing they are not the criminals Hody portrayed them to be.

quotes.text: I think the Straw Hats are not bad and may have been misjudged.
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: Fukaboshi reconsidering his initial impression of the Straw Hat Pirates

events.title: Hody Jones Overdoses on Energy Steroids
events.description: Suffering from intense pain caused by Zoro's wound, Hody Jones demands and consumes more Energy Steroids. The drugs trigger a dramatic transformation in his body.
events.significance: Critical moment that transforms Hody into his most powerful and dangerous form, while also demonstrating the horrific side effects of Energy Steroid abuse.

events.title: Hody's Monstrous Transformation
events.description: After overdosing on Energy Steroids, Hody Jones transforms into a monstrous form. He becomes far more muscular with his muscles bulging with thick veins, his body size increases dramatically, and his dark hair bleaches completely white.
events.significance: Hody's transformation into his steroid-enhanced form represents the peak of his physical power and the central visual threat of the Fish-Man Island conflict.

events.title: Neptune Explains Energy Steroids' Side Effects
events.description: King Neptune warns the Fish-Man Island citizens about the dangerous side effects of Energy Steroids, explaining that they cause accelerated aging and severe physical deterioration. He uses the metaphor that 'the candle that burns twice as bright burns half as long.'
events.significance: Provides crucial world-building information about Energy Steroids and establishes the long-term consequences that will eventually leave Hody and his crew as frail, aged husks.

quotes.text: The candle that burns twice as bright burns half as long.
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Neptune explaining the side effects of Energy Steroids

events.title: Hody Demonstrates His Enhanced Power
events.description: Hody Jones displays his newfound strength by using a devastating water shot attack on Neptune's army, leveling the entire area. The display of power shocks Neptune and terrifies the Fish-Man Island citizens and army.
events.significance: First demonstration of how dramatically Energy Steroids have amplified Hody's already formidable fish-man strength and water manipulation abilities.

events.title: Fish-Man Island Citizens React in Horror
events.description: The citizens of Fish-Man Island and Neptune's army react with horror and fear as they witness Hody's monstrous transformation and overwhelming power.
events.significance: Establishes the emotional stakes for the Fish-Man Island population and shows the terror that Hody's transformation inspires.

events.title: Luffy and Jinbe Continue Their Argument
events.description: Luffy and Jinbe continue their ongoing argument about who should be the one to stop Hody Jones and save Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: Highlights the tension between Luffy's desire to help his friends and Jinbe's belief that a fish-man should defeat Hody to prevent further racial tensions.

quotes.text: I think the Straw Hats are not bad and may have been misjudged.
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: Fukaboshi reconsidering the Straw Hats while traveling to save his father

quotes.text: The candle that burns twice as bright burns half as long.
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Neptune explaining the side effects of Energy Steroids to the citizens

themes.description: The episode explores the dangerous consequences of seeking power through shortcuts, as demonstrated by Hody's use of Energy Steroids.
themes.symbolism: Hody's white hair and monstrous appearance symbolize the corruption and deterioration that comes from abusing the Energy Steroids.

themes.description: Fukaboshi's reconsideration of the Straw Hats shows the theme of overcoming prejudice and recognizing the truth about others.
themes.symbolism: The princes' journey to save their father mirrors their journey to understanding the true nature of the Straw Hats.

themes.description: Hody's physical transformation into a more powerful but monstrous form reflects his inner corruption and hatred.
themes.symbolism: The transformation represents how hatred and prejudice can warp someone into something inhuman.

characterSpotlights.development: Hody crosses a line by overdosing on Energy Steroids, transforming into his most powerful and monstrous form. This represents both the peak of his physical power and his complete moral degradation.
keyActions: Demands more Energy Steroids despite the pain

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being captured and facing execution, Neptune maintains his dignity and tries to warn his people about the consequences of Hody's actions.
keyActions: Explains the side effects of Energy Steroids
Remains concerned for his people despite his own danger
quotes: The candle that burns twice as bright burns half as long.

characterSpotlights.development: Fukaboshi shows growth in his understanding, recognizing that the Straw Hats may have been misjudged and are not the criminals they were portrayed to be.
keyActions: Leads his brothers toward Gyoncorde Plaza
Reconsiders his opinion of the Straw Hats
Prepares to confront the New Fish-Man Pirates
quotes: I think the Straw Hats are not bad and may have been misjudged.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded the New Fish-Man Pirates officers' rampage sequences with additional destruction and action scenes.
The anime added extended sequences of Dosun's destruction and Hyouzou's drunken rampage that were more briefly depicted in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode covers material from Chapter 630 of the manga.
The opening song 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani was used for episodes 517-589, making it one of the longest-running opening themes in One Piece.
Hody's white-haired transformation from Energy Steroid overdose visually parallels the Minks' Sulong form, which has led to fan theories about a potential connection between the two.

sources.title: One Piece Theory: Are Energy Steroids Failed Sulong Pills?

trivia.fact: The Fish-Man Island Arc has a controversial reputation among fans, with some considering it one of the weaker arcs despite its important thematic content about racism and prejudice.

sources.title: Why One Piece's Fishman Island Arc Is The Absolute Worst Of The Anime
